page.description: To duplicate a table with the Duplicate Table dialog box:

step.description: Right click on a table in the Control Panel, and select Utilities > Duplicate.
Indicate which components of the source table should be duplicated, by checking any of the Records, Indexes, Dictionary, or Field Rules check boxes.

case.title: Records
case.description: Copies the data of your application

case.title: Indexes
case.description: You may not want to copy indexes, since they can be large and can be regenerated without loss of information.

case.title: Dictionary
case.description: Copies the design of your application

case.title: Field Rules
case.description: Copies the field rules used by your application

step.description: Optionally, click Save Settings to cause the current settings to be displayed the next time you open the Duplicate Table dialog box.
Enter the new table name either by:

case.description: 1. Typing it into the New Table Name field.
2. Clicking Browse and selecting a table to replace from the New Table Name dialog box.

step.description: Click OK to conclude or Cancel to discard your inputs.

see.ref: Adding Tables or Sets to a Database
